column4: I have a lazy question.  I have a windows computer downstairs.  I run Ubuntu upstairs.  I would like to be able to remotely view the Windows Desktop to troubleshoot dumb users
Can anyone help me in my quest to be lazy?
thanks sebsebseb and ubottu!
I know ubottu is a bot.  It still deserves a thank you
how true
ok not what I wanted, some bots can give a heart or whatever,  and he would give you one :d for saying what you said ha ha.  ok  off topic now
YES
didn't want caps, anyway yeah
cool.
I guess you told it not to install basero  and so it' still there, but greyed out
I did not but my CD/DVD burner is on the fritz
oh your going to clean install? or?
no, this was an upgrade from 8.10 to 9.04 RC and then 9.04 released
that should just work, as long as it was shut down properly by Windows
in the partition editor, it says "Unable to read the contents of this file system"
not sure, someone else is bound to be able to help
have you ever set up a dual boot with a shared partition before?
don't quit remember
,but yes I done dual boot a few times
did you ever have a third partition for sharing files between Windows and Ubunut?
that's for newbies
sharing files with Windows eww
makes more sense to have your really good files in Ubuntu, and your not so good ones in Windows.  and you  should just be able to access the Windows partition no problem as well from Ubuntu
,but yes I think I shared a data partition  at some stage between  Windows and Ubuntu
